reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Teen Lesbian Fairy Tale
reviews.reviewText: This book was short and sweet. It had a unique mythology. I had heard of mermaids, but not Selkies. I love that there was plus size representation in the characters, lots of diversity and it really was just a sweet coming out story with a fairy tale aspect.

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An amazing romance
reviews.reviewText: I loved it so so so much omg I love it oh my golly gee jeeb Weezer beezer silly doo

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful, Sweet Story
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for my middle school daughter for Christmas and read it before I wrapped it. There need to be more stories like this for kiddos to read who want to know that there are people like them out there. It mixes a sweet coming of age lesbian story with fantasy (a selkie, yay!) and it deals with two facets of LGBTQ coming of age: one girl is afraid of what may happen to her relationships when she comes out and the other girl is perplexed that anyone would worry about sharing truth about who they are. The art is sweet: the selkie girl is chunky, the human girl is of Asian background and both are beautiful. I love the inclusivity and the unapologetic inclusion of cartoon girls kissing. Lovely artwork with human selkies having a slight seal appearance. Bravo and I hope the author creates many more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Very cute coming of age story involving Canadian Korean teen Morgan and a selkie named Keltie. Fast, light read with good pacing, good story, good development for Morgan when it came to accepting herself and building her relationships with her friends and family.I liked the way the selkie mythology was incorporated. (Although it made me so anxious when Morgan took Keltie's seal skin and was casually wearing it. I was so afraid it'd be seen as negative or she'd lose it or something but that part of the mythology wasn't mentioned as part of the story so I had to let it go and believe it wasn't important if Keltie didn't say it was important.)Some of the minor characters had some tidbits of story here and there but I would say they weren't really developed. That was slightly disappointing because it felt like the one friend Serena was supposed to have more of a little arc of her own but it didn't feel properly fleshed out.The ending was bittersweet but for the best.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Please Write a Sequel!
reviews.reviewText: My 12 year old finished this book in a day; she got swept up and couldn't put it down. She came out a year ago and she really fell in love with Keltie and Morgan. Her only complaint was the ending because she found it sad, but no spoilers here. She's really hoping Molly will write a sequel and continue their story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Healing My Inner Child
reviews.reviewText: TLDR: this is a beautiful book about innocent love and overcoming fears. It is definitely worth a read.I grew up in a very homophobic, bigoted religious household. Being anything except heterosexual felt like the end of the world and brought along a lot of fear and self hate. After starting the journey of unlearning thoughts and behaviors brought on by the trauma, I wanted to go back and help heal the inner child that was so afraid to just be herself. I decided that a good place to start was normalizing the lgbtqia+ community, especially in an innocent context. This book is a beautiful work of art. Not only are the drawings and color palette amazing, but the message is too. All of the characters’ emotions are portrayed so well through detailed animated body language and the colors are SO vibrant. The themes in the book are equally beautiful: be yourself and prioritize open, honest communication. This was such a wonderful place to start a self healing journey for me—and wherever you are in your journey through life, this book would be a great addition.

"The Girl from the Sea" graphic novel is a mesmerizing journey through stunning visuals and a compelling narrative. The sea-themed tale immerses readers in a world of wonder. Each page is a work of art, and the story's depth resonates long after the last page is turned. A true graphic masterpiece.Perfect read for my 11 year-old.

Uma HQ linda, apaixonante, necessária e surpreendente! The girl from the sea, da estadunidense Molly Knox Ostertag, já foi publicada aqui no Brasil, o que é uma notícia ótima porque eu indico demais essa história.Nela conhecemos a humana Morgan e a selkie Keltie, e acompanhamos o relacionamento romântico entre elas. O quadrinho traz temas como primeiro amor; impactos negativos no meio ambiente; amizade; confiança; família; autodescoberta e muito mais.O que me fez gostar tanto foi, além da arte muito bonita, que a autora mostra situações muito reais de um jeito leve, mas que mesmo assim faz o leitor se questionar, seja em como vemos o mundo ou como vemos a nós mesmos e as pessoas que estão ao nosso redor. É uma história muito bonita, que poderia facilmente ser um conto de fadas.Prepare-se para se emocionar (e até derramar algumas lágrimas). Terminei já querendo reler.
El material del libro es de excelente calidad, llegó rápido. La historia en sí es hermosa,y fue un regalo excelente para una amiga.
